alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 8:16PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Stream Flooding has been reported and has flowed over some roads in the area. Streams may continue to see rises as recent rains drain into them. Additional rainfall looks to be lighter, but could still contribute to stream rises. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Interior Sonoma County. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 816 PM PST, emergency management reported flooding streams and water over the road ways in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Petaluma, Rohnert Park, Windsor, Healdsburg, Sebastopol, Cotati, Roseland, Larkfield-Wikiup, South Santa Rosa Cdp, Forestville, Guerneville, Graton, South Santa Rosa, Occidental, Monte Rio and Glen Ellen. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
